resources.string: The application allows you to determine the magnitude of the effect of gravitational time dilation in the field of massive objects. Do you want to know?

"is a smart service that allows you to determine the magnitude of the effect of gravitational time dilation in the field of massive objects. Using the application, you will be able to visually experience the physical concept of relativity over the time of general relativity."

Time is undoubtedly your most valuable resource. You want to know how to extend it, but the search for the elixir of eternal life is unsuccessful, and the time machine does not work yet. And you knew that modern physics claims that the flow of time is relative and depends on the speed of an object (the so-called relativistic deceleration) and its position in space relative to massive bodies (gravitational deceleration), such as planets, stars, and even black holes. The stronger the gravity, the slower time flows. The fact is that the fabric of space and time are the same, and therefore the flow of time, like space, is bent under the action of the gravitational field.
With this application, you can get the most accurate information about how much your own time flows faster if you climbed a high mountain or fly a plane than on the surface of the Earth.

Of course, this difference is negligible. The difference between the time measured by the clock on the tops of the mountains and on the surface of the Earth is just a few nanoseconds. And yes, given this phenomenon, it turns out that your legs - albeit infinitely slightly - are younger than your head.

"If you want to understand better - the work of Einstein on the General Theory of Relativity is already waiting for you!\n" "It was about this effect that the heroine Anne Hathaway spoke to the character Matthew McConaughey in Interstellar after descending to a distant Miller planet orbiting the black hole Gargantua: “One hour on this planet is equal to seven Earth years”."
